sen.j: 大江 維光（おおえ の これみつ、天仁3年（1110年） - 承安 (日本)5年1月18日 (旧暦)（1175年2月17日））は平安時代の貴族。
sen.e: Born in 1110 and gone on February 17, 1175, "OE no Koremitsu" was a Court noble in the Heian period.
Born in 1110 and died in February 17, 1175, "OE no Koremitsu" was a Court noble in the Heian period.
OE no Koremitsu (1110 - February 17, 1175) was a court noble in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。表記を訂正しました。court 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 中納言大江匡房の孫で、肥後国守大江維順（大江匡時）の子。
sen.e: He was the grandson of "OE no Masafusa" who reached the Court title of "Chunagon" (Middle Counselor), and the son of "OE no Korenobu" (also called "OE no Masatoki) who assumed "Higo no kuni no kami" (the governor of Higo Province).

He was the grandson of "OE no Masafusa" who reached the Court title of "Chunagon" (Middle Counselor), and the son of "OE no Korenobu" (also called "OE no Masatoki) who assumed "Higo no kuni no kami" (the governor of Higo Province).

He was the grandson of OE no Masafusa who reached the court title of Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), and the son of OE no Korenobu (also called OE no Masatoki) who assumed Higo no kuni no kami (the governor of Higo Province).
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。court 小文字にしました。(vice-councilor of state)説明訂正しました、用語統一リストより

sen.e: Koremitsu himself reached "Jusii" (Junior Fourth Court Rank) and the official of "Shikibu-sho" (Ministry of Ceremonial).
Koremitsu himself reached "Jusii" (Junior Fourth Court Rank) and the official of "Shikibu-sho" (Ministry of Ceremonial).
Koremitsu himself reached Jusii (Junior Fourth Rank) and the official of Shikibusho (Ministry of Ceremonial).
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。court 小文字にしました。ハイフン削除しました。

sen.j: 文章生から方略試に及第し、式部少輔、式部大輔等を歴任。
sen.e: When he was "monjosho" (a student of literary studies in the Imperial University), he passed "Horyakushi" (the exam for selecting Court officials), and then he held various positions, such as "Shikibu shoyu" (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial) & "Shikibu no taifu" (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).

When he was "monjosho" (a student of literary studies in the Imperial University), he passed "Horyakushi" (the exam for selecting Court officials), and then he held various positions, such as "Shikibu shoyu" (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial) & "Shikibu no taifu" (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).

When he was monjosho (a student of literary studies in the Imperial University), he passed Horyakushi (the exam for selecting Court officials), and then he held various positions, such as Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial) and Shikibu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。&をandに訂正しました。

sen.j: 紀伝道の大家として評判が高かった。
sen.e: He had a good reputation as an expert on "Kidendo" (the study of the histories).
He had a reputation as an expert on "Kidendo" (the study of the histories).
He had a reputation as an expert on Kidendo (the study of the histories).
